Once we allow companies to become this powerful, the FCC does not regulate them, says Vermont Al Franken Sen. Bernie Sanders .`` They regulate the FCC,'' says the senator. No reasonable regulator would debate Sen. Bernie Sanders 's point-or the threat to democracy posed when traditional protections against media monopoly are abandoned.

A Barbara Walters Special: A Matter of Life and Death, 10 p.m.( ABC): Bill Clinton , actor Robin Williams , and talk-show hosts David Letterman , Regis Philbin and Charlie Rose discuss their experiences as heart patients with the veteran journalist, who also discusses her own open-heart surgery. the White House and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan. 28. Although Simon Cowell is fighting for the Geordie to be involved, it's reported that bosses would prefer a big American star like Rihanna or Katy Perry . A naughty little source told the Sun: Everyone thinks Cheryl Cole has the judging job on US X Factor in the bag.`` The truth is, nothing has been signed and the producers still aren't convinced.`` They are more keen to get a big US star like Katy Perry or Rihanna on the panel- someone who will bring credibility to the show and who is already popular in the US.
